definitions.meaning: A pattern for implementing feature flags in Next.js apps.
definitions.example: Toggle features on/off for users or environments.

bestPractice: Use feature flags for safe rollouts and A/B testing.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for running A/B tests in Next.js apps.
definitions.example: Serve different variants to users for experimentation.

bestPractice: Randomize and log variant assignments for analysis.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for building multi-tenant (multi-customer) Next.js apps.
definitions.example: Serve different content based on subdomain or path.

examples:
const { host } = req.headers;
const subdomain = host.split('.')[0];
bestPractice: Isolate tenant data and configuration.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for composing a UI from independently deployable frontend apps.
definitions.example: Use microfrontends for large, modular projects.

syntax: // Use Module Federation or iframe composition
examples: // Use Webpack Module Federation to load remote components
bestPractice: Decouple microfrontends for independent deployment.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for sharing code and components across independently deployed apps.
definitions.example: Use Webpack Module Federation in Next.js monorepos.

examples: module.exports = { webpack: (config) => { /* module federation setup */ return config; } }
bestPractice: Use module federation for shared libraries and microfrontends.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for setting browser feature policies via headers in Next.js.
definitions.example: Restrict browser features for security.

bestPractice: Set feature policies to limit risky browser APIs.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for setting Content Security Policy headers in Next.js.
definitions.example: Prevent XSS by setting CSP headers.

bestPractice: Set strict CSP headers for all pages and APIs.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for using Helmet.js to set HTTP headers for security.
definitions.example: Use Helmet in custom servers.

bestPractice: Use Helmet for security headers in custom servers.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for collecting analytics data during SSR in Next.js.
definitions.example: Send analytics events during SSR.

examples: // Send event to analytics service in getServerSideProps
bestPractice: Batch SSR analytics to avoid slowing down requests.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for collecting analytics data on the client side in Next.js.
definitions.example: Send analytics events on route change.

bestPractice: Debounce analytics events to avoid flooding.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for logging errors in Next.js apps.
definitions.example: Log errors to Sentry or console.

bestPractice: Log all errors in production for debugging.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for logging errors from Error Boundaries in Next.js.
definitions.example: Log errors from ErrorBoundary to monitoring tools.

bestPractice: Log error boundaries for user-facing errors.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for custom serverless request handlers in Next.js.
definitions.example: Customize serverless logic for API routes.

examples: export default function handler(req, res) { /* custom logic */ }
bestPractice: Keep serverless handlers stateless and fast.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for logging in serverless functions in Next.js.
definitions.example: Log requests and errors in serverless handlers.

bestPractice: Log for debugging and monitoring in serverless.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for monitoring serverless functions in Next.js.
definitions.example: Monitor serverless performance and errors.

syntax: // Integrate with Datadog, Sentry, or Vercel Analytics
examples: // Add monitoring hooks to serverless handler
bestPractice: Monitor serverless for cold starts and errors.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for caching in serverless functions in Next.js.
definitions.example: Cache API responses in memory or edge.

bestPractice: Cache expensive responses to reduce latency.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for authentication in serverless functions in Next.js.
definitions.example: Authenticate users in API routes.

bestPractice: Authenticate all sensitive serverless endpoints.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for authorization in serverless functions in Next.js.
definitions.example: Authorize users for protected actions.

bestPractice: Check authorization for all protected endpoints.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for validating input in serverless functions in Next.js.
definitions.example: Validate request bodies before processing.

examples:
const schema = z.object({ name: z.string() });
schema.parse(req.body);
bestPractice: Validate all input to prevent security issues.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for using middleware in serverless functions in Next.js.
definitions.example: Compose middleware for authentication and logging.

bestPractice: Compose middleware for maintainable serverless code.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for rate limiting in serverless functions in Next.js.
definitions.example: Limit requests per user/IP.

syntax: // Use a rate limiter in handler
bestPractice: Rate limit all sensitive endpoints.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for setting CORS headers in serverless functions in Next.js.
definitions.example: Enable CORS for serverless APIs.

bestPractice: Set CORS headers for all public serverless endpoints.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for error handling in serverless functions in Next.js.
definitions.example: Return 400/500 for errors.

bestPractice: Return clear error messages and status codes.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for using schema validation in serverless functions in Next.js.
definitions.example: Validate input with Zod or Yup.

examples:
const schema = z.object({ name: z.string() });
schema.parse(req.body);
bestPractice: Use schema validation for all input.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for handling file uploads in serverless Next.js API routes.
definitions.example: Handle file uploads with multer or formidable in serverless functions.

bestPractice: Validate, limit, and sanitize uploaded files in serverless.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for serving file downloads in serverless Next.js API routes.
definitions.example: Serve files from serverless endpoints with correct headers.

bestPractice: Set correct headers for file downloads.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for handling webhooks in serverless Next.js API routes.
definitions.example: Receive webhook events in serverless endpoints.

bestPractice: Verify webhook signatures for security.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for running scheduled (cron) tasks in serverless Next.js.
definitions.example: Run periodic jobs with serverless scheduled functions.

syntax: // Use Vercel or AWS scheduled functions
examples: // Schedule a function to run every hour
bestPractice: Use provider-native cron for reliability.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for serving GraphQL endpoints in serverless Next.js API routes.
definitions.example: Serve GraphQL APIs from serverless endpoints.

examples: const server = new ApolloServer({ typeDefs, resolvers });
bestPractice: Use Apollo Server or Yoga for GraphQL endpoints.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for serving REST endpoints in serverless Next.js API routes.
definitions.example: Serve REST APIs from serverless endpoints.

examples: export default function handler(req, res) { res.status(200).json({ message: 'ok' }); }
bestPractice: Follow REST conventions for endpoint design.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for composing middleware stacks in serverless Next.js.
definitions.example: Compose multiple middleware for authentication, logging, etc.

bestPractice: Compose middleware for maintainable serverless code.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for setting HTTP headers in serverless Next.js routes.
definitions.example: Set security and caching headers in serverless endpoints.

bestPractice: Set headers for security and caching.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for using environment variables in serverless Next.js.
definitions.example: Access env variables in serverless functions.

bestPractice: Keep secrets in environment variables.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for managing configuration in serverless Next.js.
definitions.example: Configure serverless endpoints with config files or env vars.

bestPractice: Centralize config for maintainability.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for providing logging context to serverless Next.js endpoints.
definitions.example: Wrap handlers with a logging provider.

bestPractice: Use providers for consistent logging.

definitions.meaning: A pattern for providing monitoring context to serverless Next.js endpoints.
definitions.example: Wrap handlers with a monitoring provider.

bestPractice: Use providers for consistent monitoring.
